== Main Inclusion Report for automoc ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/a/automoc]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Build dependency of KDE 4's Akonadi
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=automoc|no CVE entries]]</nowiki>: ...
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=automoc|no Secunia history]]</nowiki>: ...
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid. No daemons
** No network activity
** It does process structured data, Qt UI files
** No known source code review performed
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** The package always works out of the box without configuration
** Does the package ask no debconf questions
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:automoc|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: None
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/a/automoc.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is calm
** <nowiki>[[http://websvn.kde.org/trunk/kdesupport/automoc/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is calm
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.kde.org/simple_search.cgi?id=automoc|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: Only a couple open
** Hardware: Does not deal with hardware
** There is not a test suite in the upstream source or packaging
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliance ?
** Packaging system (cdbs)
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** Qt, cmake, all in main
 0. ''Background information:''
** Upstream call it automoc
